reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a spur of the moment trip to Connemara, we came across this hotel in its wonderful location and decided to stay the night. The service here was first class and as good as any 5 star hotel I've stayed in. When I informed them that I would be getting up and going out for a dawn photoshoot, the member of staff I was talking to immediately offered to arrange tea/coffee for me before I left on the shoot. All the staff throughout our brief stay were this friendly and accommodating, and so we'll definitely be making a return visit.
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic service.

reviews.text: Four Poster beds, fantastic views, great service, lovely food for breakfast and evening meal.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal in terms of scenery and for reaching out across Conemara - you can even get over to West Port for a day out with very little trouble. Handy too for National Park and Kylemore Abbey.
reviews.title: Nice hotel located in a gorgeous place

reviews.text: There is a well stocked bar, which means you do not need to go too far for a post dinner tipple and there is great fishing just across the road from the front door ! Worth every penny.
reviews.title: No childrens menu?

reviews.text: Will come again for sure.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Ireland
We'll be back
reviews.text: Remote and rugged the Loch Inagh Lodge is a splendid and authentically archetypal Victorian pile, with the charms of a manor house and the comfort of a well run boutique hotel. Arriving too late for dinner, but not too late to sample some of the local whiskey sitting in the warmth of a peat fire, we slept soundly in comfortable quality linen in a four poster bed, in a spacious ground floor room discretely themed on Samuel Beckett.

reviews.title: Doesn't get much better
reviews.text: The large corner room had lots of windows overlooking gardens and the loch, accessed by a path about 200m in front of the hotel. Bathroom was large, functional and well equipped, with a small dressing room.

reviews.title: super spot
reviews.text: The breakfast in an attractive Victorian styled dining room was excellent with a good selection of dishes, including freshly smoked kippers, which made a change from the ubiquitous ‘traditional Irish breakfast’ which of course was also available.

reviews.title: Wonderful birthday party!
reviews.text: All in all, possibly the nicest place we stayed in Ireland, partly because of its splendid rugged setting, but mainly because of its combination of traditional style with its modern comforts. Unfortunately we were only there for one night and were unable to appreciate its charms fully, including the library, parlour and bar, nor the dinner which by all accounts is a highlight, but its certainly it will be one place we will be coming back to.

reviews.title: Wish we had stayed here longer!
reviews.text: Perfect in everyway, starting with the warm, friendly, accomodating staff. Food was excellent, amenties thoughtful. Best part for me was 1. The breakfast 2. Morning walk down the trail to the water for fabulous sunrise views. 3. Cuddling up in the wing chair by the window in the LR with fireplace burning and smelling so good, coffee in hand. 4. Evening, relaxing in LR with fireplace burning and conversations with interesting guests.

reviews.title: Gorgeous, quiet spot!
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night during a few days in the country. After Dublin and before Galway, I wanted my family (two 20-something girls) to see a quieter, different side of Ireland. This fit the bill perfectly and was beyond expectations. Granted, there was itching to do but appreciate the beauty of the area since we were there just before they were closing up for the season. But the house is a lovely, old manor house and the staff was wonderful. It was a really lovely stay. The next day we explored the Kylemore Abbey the next day...definitely worth the short drive further out. Just watch out for the sheep! They are everywhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the area visiting my daughter and decided to stay in Lough Inagh Lodge. I had been here once before for dinner and had enjoyed the food and ambiance of this beautiful Lodge nestled in the hills of Connemara (my favourite part of Ireland). We arrived in the dark had a beautiful dinner in the bar with our daughter and her friends. As this was the second time visiting and on both occasions in the dark, I was not prepared for the totally breathtaking views which we awoke to the following morning. The service and staff were welcoming and friendly. We were able to relax in the sumptuous lounge in front of the toasty warm fire reading papers and the interesting volumes of coffee table books. Would love to have stayed longer, maybe the next time..........
reviews.title: A lovely find in my favourite part of Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here for three nights recently. clearly a quiet time but wonderful for us. Food excellent . Oscar Wilde Suite lovely and whole place full of interesting artifacts, books and furniture . Staff brilliant. we had the place to ourselves. such breathtaking views over the lake and mountains. Open fire and lovely afternoon tea/coffee. dinner first class and breakfast buffet displayed as though there was a full hotel. Best breakfast and presented well. Real value for money. Waking up to the view was absolutely super. Good time to go when the colour in Connemara and Killary Harbour are beautiful. Roads quiet and can really take the time to enjoy.
reviews.title: treated like Lord and lady of the manor
More like the 'Marie Celeste'
reviews.text: First of all, let me make it clear that I was not staying and so cannot comment on food or accommodation. My wife and I were travelling on 28th September and called in just before midday with a view to having coffee and sandwiches. There was nobody on Reception and no bell on the desk. The place appeared absolutely deserted and we could have walked off with anything we wished. After 5 minutes of fruitless searching for signs of life, we gave up. A great shame as the Hotel is in a beautiful location. However, lack of any staff would suggest they are 'doing very well, thank you' or maybe they just can't be bothered!

reviews.title: Relaxing Lodge
reviews.text: This lodge is the place to relax and enjoy some of Ireland's beauty and tranquility. Thomas and staff were great. We ate in the bar of the lodge and enjoyed interaction with other guests. Drinks were excellent. Room service for breakfast was amazing. Request the Oscar Wilde suite and you'll be amazed. Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from a two night break in Lough Inagh, I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We were made very welcome, including our two Border Collies!! It is in a remarkable spot surrounded by stunning scenery. Our bedroom was very comfortable and the food excellent, we will be back!
reviews.title: Weekend break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Margaret and Michael.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel and hosts

reviews.text: We stayed at the Lough Inagh Lodge at Easter, and it was a fine experience from start to finish. We have strangely not spent much time in Connemara until recently even though we live only a couple of hours drive away. Since Christmas drawn by hiking initially at Diamond Hill, we have now visited on three separate weekends, staying on each occasion in a different hotel. By far, the best experience we have had has been at the Lough Inagh Lodge. Booking was a muddled affair on my part, as it was late evening after a late difficult day. But after unfumbling my words I conveyed that we wanted to stay two nights arriving Good Friday. Without any difficulty and with warmth and good humour the booking was taken, and the possibility of a room with a view towards the lake given. We arrived in due course, and the best of surprises awaited. We were given the Joyce suite which had a lake view through all of its many windows, and from its four poster bed. Lough Inagh Lodge is in a wonderful location, completely renovated with two cosy reception rooms that provide peaceful locations in which to chat, enjoy a hot drink, drink a glass of wine or read a book, all while listening to the crackle of the fire (Easter was cold this year). There is a peaceful bar, fantastic barman, for whom nothing seems ever to be a problem and whose good humour is contagious. We ate in the restaurant our first night, our second night, and we enjoyed our stay so much we stayed for a third night and ate in the restaurant again. The standard of food is very high and we noted other dinner guests had travelled from other hotels to sample it. Lough Inagh is perfectly placed for hikers. It attracts a nice clientel drawn by the outdoors, but who like to be able to come back to wonderful comfort at the end of a hard days trek. The owner Maire is a wonderful host, warm, friendly and helped make our stay such a pleasant one. So while we have taken a break for the summer months, we will return to Connemara come Autumn. When we do it will be the Lough Inagh Lodge that we stay in.
reviews.title: Beautiful place - first class in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions: "We'll have tea and scones ready for you in the sitting room." - no better Irish welcome; on return from a long day hillwalking : "We'll have tea and scones ..." - no better way to relax!
reviews.title: Splendid Dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are meticulously clean, beautifully furnished, incredibly spacious, lovely bedlinen, big bathroom and dressing room. Dining room - spectacular views. Sitting rooms - open fires, tea and scones. Bar - we never got there - too comfortable to move !!!
reviews.title: Will definately be returning
